means: 多汁的，多水分的，多汁性的
（植物）茎叶肥厚含水分多的，肉质的
极有兴趣的，津津有味的，有活力的

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin succulentus, from succus 'juice'

entry.tran: (尤指蔬菜及肉类)汁多味美的
entry.def: Succulent food, especially meat or vegetables, is juicy and good to eat.

example.ex: Cook pieces of succulent chicken with ample garlic and a little sherry.
example.tran: 烹饪鲜美滑嫩的鸡肉时多加些大蒜，并滴入少许雪利酒。

entry.tran: 肉质植物(叶子肥厚的植物)
entry.def: Succulents or succulent plants are types of plants which have thick, fleshy leaves.

example.ex: His potted succulents were looking parched.
example.tran: 他盆栽的肉质植物看起来已经干枯了。

means.word_mean: 1. a plant adapted to arid conditions and characterized by fleshy water-storing tissues that act as water reservoirs
